intro: Lannea wodier, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its thick, rugged bark and waxy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits that are an important food source for various animals. Lannea wodier is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils and in disturbed habitats. Its resilience and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native range.
